raw_text:
Souness delight at Euro progress
 
 Boss Graeme Souness felt Newcastle were never really in danger of going out of the Uefa Cup against Heerenveen.
 
 An early own goal followed by an Alan Shearer strike earned them a 2-1 win and a place in the Uefa Cup last 16. "Obviously with winning in the first leg it gave us a great advantage," he said after the 4-2 aggregate victory. "We got our goals early and in the minds of some players the job was done but then they got a goal and perhaps made us a bit nervous." Shearer's goal moved him within 12 of Jackie Milburn's club scoring record of 200 for the Magpies. But Souness said he did not think beating the record would have any bearing on his decision to retire at the end of the season. "I think if he got it this year he would want to stay next year anyway," he added.
 
 "He struck the ball very well - he always has done - and I think it was the power and pace that beat the goalkeeper." Souness also paid tribute to Laurent Robert, who was at the heart of much of United's attacking play. "In the first half he did really well and did everything you want from a wide player. More of the same in future please," he said.
llama3.2:1b: Graeme Souness felt Newcastle won against Heerenveen 2-1, progressing to the UEFA Cup last 16 with an early own goal followed by Alan Shearer's strike and later Robert's assist.
llama3.2:3b: Boss Graeme Souness believed Newcastle's 4-2 aggregate win over Heerenveen was not a concern, with Alan Shearer scoring twice and Laurent Robert performing well for United. The wins earned them a place in the Uefa Cup last 16, but Souness said retiring at season's end would not be influenced by Shearer breaking the club scoring record of 200.
gemma2:2b: Newcastle won their Uefa Cup tie against Heerenveen 2-1, advancing to the last 16 with a 4-2 aggregate victory. Alan Shearer's goal moved him closer to Jackie Milburn's club scoring record, but Souness was not focused on it for retirement.  He highlighted Laurent Robert's contributions in attack as crucial to the success.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The match for the UEFA Cup was not as critical for Newcastle United as Graeme Souness had expected. They managed to win the game 2-1, securing their place in the final while also generating interest and excitement among players and fans alike. Additionally, their own goal against Heerenveen earned them a valuable lead over the Magpies in the tournament. However, Graeme Souness acknowledged that beating the record for club goals would not necessarily impact his decision to retire at the end of the season. On the other hand, he also praised Laurent Robert for his contributions to United's attacking play.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Graeme Souness praises Newcastle's Euro progress after defeating Heerenveen 2-1, winning the Uefa Cup last 16 with an early goal advantage. Alan Shearer scores to move within 12 goals of club record for Newcastle United, while Laurent Robert is commended for his playmaking abilities.
qwen2.5:3b: Boss Graeme Souness praised Newcastle for securing a 2-1 victory over Heerenveen, which gave them an aggregate win and placed them in the Uefa Cup last 16. The win was significant as it reduced the risk of elimination. Alan Shearer scored early to provide Newcastle with a lead that seemed secure but briefly threatened their confidence. Souness noted Shearer's progress towards equaling Jackie Milburn's club record, though he did not believe this would influence Shearer’s decision to retire at season’s end. Laurent Robert was highlighted for his effective play in attacking positions.
opencoder:1.5b:
Souness delight at Euro progress. Boss Graeme Souness felt Newcastle were never really in danger of going out of the Uefa Cup against Heerenveen.

An early own goal followed by an Alan Shearer strike earned them a 2-1 win and a place in the Uefa Cup last 16.

Suddenly, he gave us a great advantage after winning in the first leg. He said that the job was done but then they got a goal. Perhaps making us nervous could have been a factor. After this, he moved him within 12 of Jackie Milburn's club scoring record of 200 for the Magpies.

He struck the ball very well - he always has done - and I think it was the power and pace that beat the goalkeeper. Souness also paid tribute to Laurent Robert who was at the heart of much of United’s attacking play.

His decision to retire would likely have been beneficial in the future, as with winning in the first leg, he could have enjoyed a lot more.

"Obviously with winning in the first leg it gave us a great advantage," he said after the 4-2 aggregate victory. "We got our goals early and in the minds of some players the job was done." Souness added that he did not think beating the record would have any bearing on his decision to retire at the end of the season. "I think if he got it this year he would want to stay next year anyway," he said.

Boss Graeme Souness was happy with his performance as well and credited him for winning the game. Souness added that he did not think beating the record would have any bearing on his decision to retire at the end of the season. "I think if he got it this year he would want to stay next year anyway," he said.

First, I'll read through the text carefully. It starts with Souness delight at Euro progress, then moves on to their match against Heerenveen. The main focus seems to be about how they feel they're safe going into the Uefa Cup semi-finals. 

In the second paragraph, there's a detailed account of the game: Souness scored first, then Alan Shearer struck. It mentions their win and their place in the Uefa Cup last 16. There's some player reactions about how beating their record might not influence their retirement choice.

The third part is about Robert, who was key to their attack. Souness praises him for his performance, especially his role as a wide player. He ends by saying he hopes Robert continues to do that in the future.

I need to condense all this into a concise summary. I'll make sure to include the main points: their confidence going into the competition, the game's outcome, key players like Shearer and Robert, and their retirement thoughts. 

I should also note that Souness feels they're safe but not overly confident because Heerenveen could change things. The mention of Shearer's proximity to his club's record is interesting but maybe not essential unless it adds context.

Souness feels confident about their upcoming match against Heerenveen and believes they are safe entering the Uefa Cup semi-finals. They scored early, but the game ended with a win for Shearer, setting them on track for the last 16. The coach expressed some uncertainty if beating Shearer's record would influence his retirement decision. Laurent Robert was praised for his attacking prowess, especially as a wide player, who he hopes to continue excelling in the future.
tinyllama:1.1b: Newcastle United boss Graeme Souness believes that Heerenveen's early own goal was "a great advantage" for them, despite conceding an injury-time equalizer from Alan Shearer. Despite the victory, however, Souness expressed his desire to retire at the end of the season and was content with the job done by his team. Regarding goalscorer Laurent Robert's chances of staying with Newcastle for next season, Souness said that he thought Robert would prefer to remain due to his impressive performance in the club's attacking play. However, Souness also credited Robert for "everything" he did during the game, including the late equalizer.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Heerenveen 2-1 Newcastle United Uefa Cup last 16 match saw Heerenveen pile pressure with a strong start and an away goal, but it was Souness's team who emerged victorious. The 1-0 scoreline at the break saw both teams looking to find the perfect balance between attacking and defensive play. Newcastle United were able to dominate the midfield, creating chances for their attackers in the box and on the wings. They also managed to keep the ball for longer periods than Heerenveen, which proved to be a crucial aspect of their attacking play. Alan Shearer's 20th-century record was broken by Souness, as he became the first player to score in the first leg of the Uefa Cup against Heerenveen. His goal at the beginning of the second half allowed Newcastle United to maintain their lead and secure a historic victory. Souness also praised his team's performance in the air, with Laurent Robert's ability to find the ball and run with it being an outstanding aspect of their game. The result leaves Newcastle United as favorites for the second leg and their next match against FC Twente.
phi:2.7b: Newcastle's win over Heerenveen secured their place in the Uefa Cup last 16. The team was not initially worried about losing, but an own goal and Alan Shearer's strike gave them a 2-1 victory. Souness praised Shearer for his goalscoring record but said he would not let it affect his decision to retire. He also complimented Robert for his contribution to the team's attacking play.
orca-mini:3b: Graeme Souness was pleased with Newcastle's performance in the UEFA Cup against Heerenveen, as they won 2-1 in the first leg and advanced to the last 16. Alan Shearer scored two goals to help the team secure their win. Despite some nervous moments for the team, Souness believed that beating the club scoring record of Jackie Milburn would not have any bearing on his decision to retire at the end of the season. He also praised Laurent Robert's performance in the attacking line, saying he did everything they wanted from a wide player.
hermes3:3b: Souness happy, Newcastle safe from Heerenveen Uefa Cup elimination, with aggregate 4-2 win; Graeme Souness pleased, Shearer closer to scoring record (12 away from Jackie Milburn's 200).
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Newcastle manager Graeme Souness felt his team never posed a significant threat to Heerenveen in the Uefa Cup, leading to a 2-1 win and a place in the last 16. Souness praised Alan Shearer for scoring an early own goal and Alan Shearer strike, and also commended Laurent Robert's performance as a key attacking player. Despite Shearer's close proximity to Jackie Milburn's club scoring record of 200 goals, Souness emphasized that beating the record wouldn't influence his decision to retire at the end of the season.

An early own goal and an Alan Shearer strike gave Newcastle control, though Heerenveen's goal caused some nervous moments. Shearer's goal brought him closer to Jackie Milburn's club record, but Souness did not believe it would influence his retirement decision. He praised Shearer's finishing ability and highlighted Laurent Robert's strong attacking performance, urging him to maintain that level in future matches.
stablelm2:1.6b: Newcastle captain Alan Shearer scored twice as they beat Heerenveen 4-2 in the UEFA Cup aggregate, securing their place in the last 8. Boss Graeme Souness praised the team's early goals and avoided making the game too nervous after Shearer's second goal. Souness also commends Laurent Robert for his performance, calling him a "very good wide player" in future matches.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Newcastle, under manager Graeme Souness, secured their place in the Uefa Cup last 16 with a 4-2 aggregate victory over Heerenveen. The team's early goals, an own goal and Alan Shearer's strike, settled any doubts about their progression. Shearer's goal, which brought him closer to Jackie Milburn's record of 200 for Newcastle, did not sway Souness' decision to retire at the end of the season. Souness praised Shearer's precise and powerful shot, and Laurent Robert for his strong first-half performance as the team's key attacker.
reference: "We got our goals early and in the minds of some players the job was done but then they got a goal and perhaps made us a bit nervous."But Souness said he did not think beating the record would have any bearing on his decision to retire at the end of the season."In the first half he did really well and did everything you want from a wide player."He struck the ball very well - he always has done - and I think it was the power and pace that beat the goalkeeper.""I think if he got it this year he would want to stay next year anyway," he added.
